title: Florida Records Nation’s One-Day Peak for New Virus Cases
description: The state recorded 15,300 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, easily passing the previous one-day high of 12,274 set at the height of the outbreak in New York in April.

title: Coronavirus Live Updates: Florida Tops U.S. Record With Over 15,000 New Cases
description: Florida set a single-day U.S. record with over 15,000 new cases. Education Secretary Betsy DeVos pushes for U.S. schools to reopen.

title: Pittsburgh Seemed Like a Virus Success Story. Now Cases Are Surging.
description: Pittsburgh, a sister city to Wuhan, China, saw only modest cases for months. In the last two weeks, cases are suddenly soaring.

title: Fracking Firms Fail, Rewarding Executives and Raising Climate Fears
description: Oil and gas companies are hurtling toward bankruptcy, raising fears that wells will be left leaking planet-warming pollutants, with cleanup cost left to taxpayers.

title: What Donald Trump’s ‘Access Hollywood’ Weekend Says About 2020
description: On a Friday, the world heard vulgar audio of Mr. Trump boasting about forcing himself on women. By Sunday night, the episode that was supposed to doom him had begun to recede.

title: Ja’Ron Smith’s Balancing Act: A Black Republican Navigates the Trump White House
description: As a congressional staff member, Mr. Smith once wore a hoodie in a demonstration on Capitol Hill protesting the death of Trayvon Martin. Now President Trump calls him “my star.”

title: Trump vs. the Women Who Lead Michigan: A Battle With 2020 Implications
description: The president has picked fights with Michigan’s governor, attorney general and secretary of state over voting rights and the coronavirus. They haven’t backed down.

title: Alabama Senate Race: Sessions Faces Voters After Years of Trump Scorn
description: Tuesday’s runoff election for Senate may finally settle Jeff Sessions’ yearslong standoff with President Trump, as Republicans referee between a native son and a president they admire.

title: While America Looks Away, Autocrats Crack Down on Digital News Sites
description: Independent journalism is on the defensive, from Hungary to Malaysia.

title: The Sunday Read: ‘The Decameron Project’
description: A series of short stories written in this moment, for this moment.

title: Sports in a Pandemic Don’t All Stink
description: Virtual cycling offers lessons for how other sports can appeal to fans leading increasingly digital lives.

title: David Mitchell’s Vast and Tangled Universe
description: Daniel Mendelsohn discusses Mitchell’s career and new novel, “Utopia Avenue,” and Maria Konnikova talks about “The Biggest Bluff.”

title: American Horror, Starring Donald Trump
description: The coronavirus pandemic is spiraling out of control, largely because of the president himself.

title: What Trump Wants From Roger Stone
description: The president needs political help, and who better to give it than his political guru of many decades?

title: Dear Liberal Arts Students, You Haven’t Been Robbed
description: The world needs you. Here’s your chance.

title: Trump’s Shocking Inaction on Russia
description: Neglecting aggression by Vladimir Putin inevitably invites more of it.

title: It’s 2022. What Does Life Look Like?
description: The pandemic could shape the world, much as World War II and the Great Depression did.

title: Liar, Liar, Nation on Fire
description: I’m positive that Trump’s toxic.

title: You Should Start Writing Letters
description: Zoom calls and texts are emotionally draining, but exchanging handwritten notes can be sublime.

title: Rename theMilitary Bases That Honor Confederates
description: The military should rechristen bases named for Confederates. Better options are not hard to find.

title: I’ve Seen a Future Without Cars, and It’s Amazing
description: Why do American cities waste so much space on cars?

title: The Republicans Who Want to Destroy Trump
description: Their party’s a lost cause. America isn’t.

title: 'Defund the Police,' 'Cancel Rent': The Left Remakes the World
description: “Defund the police” and “cancel rent” aren’t reforms, but paths to revolution.

title: The Last Reporter in Town Had One Big Question for His Rich Boss
description: His newspaper has withered under a hedge fund. His industry was in turmoil even before a pandemic. But Evan Brandt won’t stop chronicling his town.

title: Carl Reiner, Perfect
description: The director and funnyman taught Steve Martin about film and comedy, but it’s Reiner’s advice on a completely different subject that he cherishes.

title: Court Clears Way for First Federal Execution in 17 Years to Proceed
description: Daniel Lewis Lee is set to be put to death after an appeals panel rejected a suit from his victims’ family members, who said the coronavirus prevented them from traveling to the execution.

title: 11-Year-Old, 2 Teens Killed in Crash at Floyd Bennett Field
description: Four other teenagers were also injured in the collision, which occurred when the teenage drivers were doing stunts at Floyd Bennett Field, the police said.

title: ESPN Suspends N.B.A. Reporter for Vulgar Reply to Senator
description: Adrian Wojnarowski, who is known for his “Woj bombs” of breaking news, emailed a different kind to a U.S. senator.

title: Graham to Call Mueller to Testify Before Senate Judiciary Committee
description: The announcement is the latest effort by Senate Republicans to press forward with an election-year bid to discredit the Trump-Russia investigation.

title: 2 Police Officers Are Shot and Killed in McAllen, Texas
description: The officers were responding to a domestic disturbance call when a man opened fire on them, the authorities said. That man later took his own life.

title: Fire Breaks Out on U.S.S. Bonhomme Richard in San Diego
description: A Navy spokesman said that 17 sailors and four civilians were being treated for injuries after a fire and explosion aboard the U.S.S. Bonhomme Richard.

title: Southside Johnny Brings Live Music Back to the Jersey Shore
description: With the music venues of the Jersey Shore shut because of the coronavirus, Southside Johnny and the Asbury Jukes staged a drive-in concert.

title: Poland’s Presidential Election Too Close to Call
description: President Andrzej Duda leads a conservative government that has fought to control courts and the news media while stoking fear of gay people and foreigners. He was challenged by the liberal mayor of Warsaw.

title: Are Uber and Lyft Drivers Well Paid? It Depends on the Study
description: Uber and Lyft hailed a Cornell paper’s conclusion that their drivers make solid wages. But others have questioned the researchers’ approach.

title: The Greatest Wedding Reception Dance Songs
description: Wedding D.J.’s share their top tunes that are guaranteed to get all of your guests dancing.

title: Here Are the U.S. States With Travel Restrictions
description: A third of states have strict measures in place for visitors, from mandatory testing to quarantine requirements.

title: What Does it Mean to be ‘At Home’ These Days?
description: People are experiencing the reopening of the country in different ways in different regions. They are responding to it differently, too.

title: Should We Be Drinking Less?
description: Scientists helping to update the latest edition of the Dietary Guidelines for Americans are taking a harder stance on alcohol.

title: Missing the Partner You See 24/7
description: How to feel connected when you have nowhere to go.

title: This Is Theater in 2020. Will It Last? Should It?
description: Our critics discuss the last four months, which thanks to Zoom (and Meryl Streep) have been full of experimentation and playfulness.

title: When ‘Keep Your Distance’ Has Been a Way of Life
description: Quarantine life puts a son’s relationship with his mother into a new light.

title: In Charlie Kaufman’s Novel, a Comic Hero Is Haunted by a Lost Film
description: “Antkind,” Kaufman’s hallucinogenic debut novel, features the madcap effort to reconstruct a masterpiece of outsider cinema.

title: This Salmon Recipe Shines
description: These dishes celebrate fresh produce and keep it simple for summer eating.

title: Airborne Coronavirus: What You Should Do Now
description: How to protect yourself from a virus that may be floating indoors? Better ventilation, for starters. And keep wearing those masks.

title: This Ancient Sea Creature Builds Its Body With a Whisper, Not a Scream
description: Unlike vertebrate embryo cells, which signal to each other over long distances, sea squirt embryo cells talk only to those they’re closest to.

title: Canada’s Sparrows Are Singing a New Song. You’ll Hear It Soon.
description: Over 20 years, scientists tracked the transformation of the traditional trill of a common bird from western Canada to Ontario.

title: Does Your Local Doctor Have a Coronavirus Test for You?
description: Primary care physicians, to whom many anxious patients turn first when their health declines, can’t always provide tests — or answers about where to get them.

title: Man, 30, Dies After Attending a ‘Covid Party,’ Texas Hospital Says
description: “I thought this was a hoax,” the man told his nurse, a hospital official said.

title: Try Spelling Bee
description: Puzzle throughout the day to see how many words you can find.

title: The Crossword, Vertex and More
description: Solve the daily puzzle edited by Will Shortz, or try out other games like the Mini and Letter Boxed.

title: Try Tiles
description: Our soothing matching game may help you de-stress.
